forecast.time_left_until_outcome_known: About 41 days until July 1, 2025 (and Metaculus may check any time on or after that date).
forecast.status_quo_outcome: No — current regional security situation and airline suspensions make >51 destinations unlikely absent a clear rebound.
forecast.no_outcome_scenario: Continued cross‑border hostilities keep risk advisories high, European carriers and some leisure/seasonal services remain suspended, and the BEY page on flightsfrom.com shows roughly mid‑40s to low‑50s destinations, not exceeding 51 when checked in early July.
forecast.yes_outcome_scenario: MEA and Gulf/regional carriers sustain a broad network, several seasonal summer routes (e.g., Mediterranean leisure, secondary Egypt/Turkey/Iraq points, select European cities) operate as scheduled, and a couple of major European resumptions tip the BEY page to 52+ destinations when checked in July.
forecast.rationale:
- Base rates and structure: Beirut (BEY) is MEA’s hub and historically supports a diversified regional network across the Gulf, Saudi Arabia (multiple cities), Iraq (several cities), Egypt (multiple airports), Turkey (IST/SAW and possibly Antalya), Levant (Amman, Larnaca, Athens), Caucasus (Yerevan, Tbilisi), Iran (Tehran), and a set of European trunk points (e.g., Paris, London, Rome/Milan, Geneva/Zurich, Vienna/Brussels). In stable times, this can approach or exceed 50 unique destinations.
- Headwinds: Since late 2023, security risk from Israel–Hezbollah hostilities has depressed tourism and led to intermittent airline suspensions. Recent reporting (e.g., “summer canceled” narratives) suggests weak inbound demand and risk-averse European leisure carriers. Carriers tend to cut frequency first but also prune seasonal points; some majors have paused BEY at various times. With roughly six weeks to go, large-scale resumptions adding several unique destinations are less likely.
- Tailwinds: BEY’s regional diaspora and essential travel underpin resilient links to Gulf/Saudi, Iraq, Egypt, Jordan, Turkey, and a few European hubs. Summer schedules, if intact, can add seasonal points (e.g., Antalya, Greek islands/cities, Egyptian resorts). The threshold is modest (52+). If two or three European resumptions plus a couple of seasonal leisure routes materialize, it could clear 51.
- Status quo weighting: Given the slow-moving nature of airline scheduling, and with only ~6 weeks to go, I put extra weight on the current schedule. The conflict backdrop and weak tourism argue that today’s network is at or below the threshold, with limited upside before July.
- Why not higher: Security/risk advisories and cost pressures on Lebanon’s hospitality sector make additional European/seasonal launches improbable near term. Even if frequencies rise, unique-destination count may not.
- Why not lower: MEA’s hub still spans many MENA points; Iraq/Saudi/Egypt/UAE/Qatar/Kuwait/Bahrain alone can tally a large share. A few European hubs and seasonal leisure routes could push the count near the low‑50s, so a >51 outcome remains plausible.
- Key updates to watch: (1) The current flightsfrom.com/BEY destination count for late June–July; (2) announcements of resumptions or cancellations by Air France, Turkish, Pegasus, European leisure carriers, and MEA seasonal routes (e.g., Antalya, Greek islands, Egyptian resorts); (3) any escalation leading to airspace restrictions or airport closures (downside); (4) de‑escalation and tourism corridor promotions that trigger late seasonal adds (upside).
- Research assistant: No additional information was provided, so this forecast relies on structural network knowledge, recent regional conditions, and timing relative to the summer schedule load.

prompt:
You are a professional forecaster interviewing for a job.

Your interview question is:
Will there be greater than 51 direct flight destinations from Beirut, Lebanon on July 1, 2025?

Question background:
Catholic News Agency: [Lebanon will soon have its own ‘camino,’ once traveled by Christ and the Romans](https://www.catholicnewsagency.com/news/263055/caminos-lebanon-new-initiative-is-designed-to-revive-religious-tourism-in-the-country) | Travel and Tour World: [Lebanon’s Hospitality Sector In Peril: Rising Costs And Low Tourism Threaten Survival](https://www.travelandtourworld.com/news/article/lebanons-hospitality-sector-in-peril-rising-costs-and-low-tourism-threaten-survival/) | The New Arab: [Summer canceIled: Israeli attack hits Lebanon tourism hopes](https://www.newarab.com/news/summer-canceiled-israeli-attack-hits-lebanon-tourism-hopes)


This question's outcome will be determined by the specific criteria below. These criteria have not yet been satisfied:
This question resolves as **Yes** if there are greater than 51 direct flight destinations listed at the [All scheduled direct (non-stop) flights from Beirut (BEY)](https://www.flightsfrom.com/BEY) tracker when checked by Metaculus on or after July 1, 2025.




Your research assistant's report says:
No additional information available.

Today is 2025-05-21.

Before answering you think:
(a) The time left until the outcome to the question is known.
(b) The status quo outcome if nothing changed.
(c) A brief description of a scenario that results in a No outcome.
(d) A brief description of a scenario that results in a Yes outcome.
(e) You write your rationale remembering that good forecasters put extra weight on the status quo outcome since the world changes slowly most of the time. Explain your reasoning and the evidence behind your forecast in detail. Summarise information your received from your research assistant that influences your forecast (if any). Explain why your forecast is not higher, and why it is not lower. Outline what would need to be true for you to update your forecast in either direction.
(f) The last thing you write is your final probabilistic forecast as a number between 0 and 100.

    "time_left_until_outcome_known": "string",
    "status_quo_outcome": "string",
    "no_outcome_scenario": "string",
    "yes_outcome_scenario": "string",
    "rationale": "string",
    "probability": "number" (0-100)
}
